title: Introduction
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?
background: Click on the YouTube link provided to you to watch the introduction video

phrasings.question_phrasing: What Racing Platform was used for the Virtual Race 2 .conf?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Refer to the video

hints.hint: It is the racing simulator referenced in the YouTube video

title: Introduction
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: For the data set being used for the BOTN, where did we race?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Refer to the video

hints.hint: Starts with a T but sounds like it starts with a S

title: Introduction
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: For the data set being used for the BOTN, when was the race?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Refer to the video

hints.hint: MM/DD/YYYY format

title: Introduction
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: What was the format for the event? (What are the 3 segments)
phrasings.answer_guidance: Refer to the video

hints.hint: The three segments Cory referenced in the video

title: Introduction
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: What time should the race have started
phrasings.answer_guidance: Refer to the video

hints.hint: Times are in ET

title: Let's Look Under The Hood
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?
background: Let's get familiar with the data we collected for our VR2C. First, go to the BOTN - VR2C App in Splunk and explore the data

phrasings.question_phrasing: How many total events are there in the iracing index?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Looking for all the events in this index

hints.hint: Set Time Picker to All Time

title: Let's Look Under The Hood
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: Change the Time Picker to only show events related to the Tsukiba Race, how many events are there?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Looking for only the events that were apart of the race portion of Tsukuba

hints.hint: Set Time Picker to Tsukuba Race

title: Let's Look Under The Hood
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: Add the "normalisedrace" source to your search. How many events are there now?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Search will include events from only one source

hints.hint: Sources are found in Selected Fields

title: Let's Look Under The Hood
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: How many hosts are sending data?
phrasings.answer_guidance: host is a selected field

hints.hint: Use the same search as before

title: Let's Look Under The Hood
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: Which host had the most events?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Which host has the top value

hints.hint: Click on the host field

title: Let's Look Under The Hood
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: How many fields are there?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Use seach, dont count the fields

hints.hint: fieldsummary is the command

title: I've got a need, a need for Speed!
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?
background: For this section we are going to explore what everyone wants to know... how fast did everyone go and is that important? You will be using the same base search and time picker from the previous section

phrasings.question_phrasing: What was the top speed reached during the race?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Speed is in MPH

hints.hint: The Stats Command is your friend
You are looking for Max speed

title: I've got a need, a need for Speed!
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: Which racer had the fastest speed (rounded to the nearest integer)?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Each host was a racer and there might be more than 1

hints.hint: From your previous seach which host posted the fastes speed?
By the Stats to the Max

title: I've got a need, a need for Speed!
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: What was the average speed for the race? (Round to the nearest integer)
phrasings.answer_guidance: Looking for the total average speed

hints.hint: Eval can help Round
Avg works with Stats

title: I've got a need, a need for Speed!
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: Which Racer had the fastest average speed?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Each host was a racer and there might be more than 1

hints.hint: host is a clause for your first command
Use the Stats

title: Rubbin' is Racing, how much damage did we cause?
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?
background: For this section we are going to explore how good the racees actually were. We are going to look at how much damage they caused and the effect on the race. You will be using the same base search and time picker from the previous section

phrasings.question_phrasing: What was the total amount of Incident points in the race?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Incident points are found in the PlayerCarMyIncidentCount field

hints.hint: You will need to find out how many incident points each host got and then add them together
addcoltotals will help you not have to do math

title: Rubbin' is Racing, how much damage did we cause?
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: Which Racer had the most incident points
phrasings.answer_guidance: We are looking for most incident points at the end of the race

hints.hint: Look for the max number for each host
do not sum a host's incident points

title: Rubbin' is Racing, how much damage did we cause?
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: Who had the least incident points?
phrasings.answer_guidance: We are looking for who had the least incident points at the end of the race

hints.hint: You can run the same search as the last question and take the opposite

title: Rubbin' is Racing, how much damage did we cause?
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: How many Pit Stops were there in the Race?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Assume pit stops take 3 minutes so events should be grouped in 3 min intervals

hints.hint: Transaction Command in 3 min intervals will bucket pitstops
PlayerCarInPitStop = True is a pit stop

title: Rubbin' is Racing, how much damage did we cause?
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: Fast repairs accelerate the repair time in the pit. The amount of fast repairs arent unlimited. Who used the most during the race?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Dont sum the fast repairs, look for the number each racer has at the end of the race

hints.hint: Stats by host is needed
latest arguement is needed with stats

title: If you ain't first, your last.
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?
background: For this section we will use both the VR2C Dashboard and Search in Splunk to see who the race winner is and explore some data points to show why the winner won

phrasings.question_phrasing: Navigate to the VR2C Dashboard. Who won the race?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Use the dashboard in the BOTN-VR2C App

hints.hint: Dashboards are located on the App Ribbon

title: If you ain't first, your last.
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: Go back to the search tab in the BOTN-VR2C App. Using the same index, source and time range as the previous sections, How many laps did the race winner complete?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Use the winner as the host in your search

hints.hint: Dont sum the laps, look for the max laps
Stats is the best command

title: If you ain't first, your last.
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: Navigate to the VR2C Dashboard. What was the fastest lap time (provide the exact value to the thousandth of a second)?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Use the dashboard in the BOTN-VR2C App

hints.hint: Dashboards are located on the App Ribbon

title: If you ain't first, your last.
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: Who got the fastest lap time of the race?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Open the panel from the previous question in search and use that as your baseline

hints.hint: Add the host clause to the stats command

title: If you ain't first, your last.
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: Having the fastest lap is nice but consistancy is critical for racing. Who had the fastest average lap time? Navigate to the VR2C Dashboard and check it out!
phrasings.answer_guidance: Use the dashboard in the BOTN-VR2C App

hints.hint: The bar chart with the smallest bar is the answer

title: If you ain't first, your last.
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: No one wants to run out of fuel. Who was the closest?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Navigate to the VR2C dashboard and look for who had the lowest fuel level at the end of the race.

hints.hint: The lowest number is the right number

title: If you ain't first, your last.
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: Winning isnt everything... Most Improved is pretty important too. Navigate to the VR2C Dashboard to see who had the most improved placement from their start time to finish
phrasings.answer_guidance: Look at the poll position of where people started and where they finished

hints.hint: Look for the biggest difference in poll positions

title: If you ain't first, your last.
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: Open the Poll Start and Finish panel in search. Apply an eval command to get the delta of everyone's poll placements from Start to Finish. What is the average Delta?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Round to 2 decimal places

hints.hint: Start - Finish = Delta
Stats and Avg is like Peanut Butter and Jelly
